post_text: Governor Pritzker has extended remote learning through the end of the school year. Thank you to our D87 community for your support during this difficult time. Your safety and health are our top priority. Remote learning and meal services will continue through the end of the school year. Stay safe and stay connected!

post_text:
After careful consideration of information from the Illinois Department of Public Health (IDPH) regarding preventative measures to limit the spread of the coronavirus in our community, we are closing schools beginning Monday, March 16th with a tentative return date of April 6th. Students will be dismissed at their early dismissal times today.

We will begin our e-learning plan on Monday. Additional information will be sent today, so please watch for communication from your school.

Thank you for your patience during this challenging time. The safety and health of our students and staff is our top priority.
text:
After careful consideration of information from the Illinois Department of Public Health (IDPH) regarding preventative measures to limit the spread of the coronavirus in our community, we are closing schools beginning Monday, March 16th with a tentative return date of April 6th. Students will be dismissed at their early dismissal times today.

We will begin our e-learning plan on Monday. Additional information will be sent today, so please watch for communication from your school.

Thank you for your patience during this challenging time. The safety and health of our students and staff is our top priority.

post_text: Due to extreme weather all Berkeley 87 schools and offices will be closed on Wednesday, January 30th and Thursday, January 31st. These will be Self-Directed Learning Days for all students and staff. Be sure to check with your child what learning opportunities they can do while at home! Stay warm and see you Friday!

post_text:
Monday, October 2nd was Custodian Appreciation Day. On behalf of Berkeley School District 87's School Board and Administration, we would like to thank all of our custodians for keeping our schools and district facilities clean, safe, and functioning on a daily basis. Custodian Appreciation Day is a great opportunity to acknowledge the outstanding work that our custodians do on a daily basis.
One District. One Team. One Mission.

post_text: Thank you to the many staff, students, and families who were able to attend our District 87 Walk-a-Thon to support students impacted by Hurricane Harvey. It was amazing to see such a wonderful showing of support for others as District 87 truly came together as One District. One Team. One Mission! $1,372.25 was raised during the walk-a-thon!
text: Thank you to the many staff, students, and families who were able to attend our District 87 Walk-a-Thon to support students impacted by Hurricane Harvey. It was amazing to see such a wonderful showing of support for others as District 87 truly came together as One District. One Team. One Mission! $1,372.25 was raised during the walk-a-thon!

post_text: Please join us for our Walk-a-Thon to raise funds for students impacted by Hurricane Harvey. Bus transportation will be available from Whittier (8:10 a.m.) and Riley/Northlake (8:20 a.m.). Cash donations will be accepted at the event. Meet in the parking lot of St. Domitilla Church in Hillside for a 1.5 mile walk along the Prairie Path. All families welcome!
